info.title: HashiCorp Vault API
info.description: HTTP API that gives you full access to Vault. All API routes are prefixed with `/v1/`.

get.summary: Read the current JWT authentication backend configuration.

post.summary: Configure the JWT authentication backend.
post.description:
The JWT authentication backend validates JWTs (or OIDC) using the configured
credentials. If using OIDC Discovery, the URL must be provided, along
with (optionally) the CA cert to use for the connection. If performing JWT
validation locally, a set of public keys must be provided.

bound_issuer.description: The value against which to match the 'iss' claim in a JWT. Optional.

default_role.description: The default role to use if none is provided during login. If not set, a role is required during login.

jwks_ca_pem.description: The CA certificate or chain of certificates, in PEM format, to use to validate connections to the JWKS URL. If not set, system certificates are used.

jwks_url.description: JWKS URL to use to authenticate signatures. Cannot be used with "oidc_discovery_url" or "jwt_validation_pubkeys".

jwt_supported_algs.description: A list of supported signing algorithms. Defaults to RS256.

jwt_validation_pubkeys.description: A list of PEM-encoded public keys to use to authenticate signatures locally. Cannot be used with "jwks_url" or "oidc_discovery_url".

oidc_client_id.description: The OAuth Client ID configured with your OIDC provider.

oidc_client_secret.description: The OAuth Client Secret configured with your OIDC provider.

oidc_discovery_ca_pem.description: The CA certificate or chain of certificates, in PEM format, to use to validate connections to the OIDC Discovery URL. If not set, system certificates are used.

oidc_discovery_url.description: OIDC Discovery URL, without any .well-known component (base path). Cannot be used with "jwks_url" or "jwt_validation_pubkeys".

/auth/oidc/login.description: Authenticates to Vault using a JWT (or OIDC) token.

post.summary: Authenticates to Vault using a JWT (or OIDC) token.

role.description: The role to log in against.

post.summary: Request an authorization URL to start an OIDC login flow.

redirect_uri.description: The OAuth redirect_uri to use in the authorization URL.

role.description: The role to issue an OIDC authorization URL against.

get.summary: Callback endpoint to complete an OIDC login.

/auth/oidc/role.description: Lists all the roles registered with the backend.

get.summary: Lists all the roles registered with the backend.
get.description: The list will contain the names of the roles.

/auth/oidc/role/{name}.description: Register an role with the backend.

get.summary: Read an existing role.

post.summary: Register an role with the backend.
post.description:
A role is required to authenticate with this backend. The role binds
		JWT token information with token policies and settings.
		The bindings, token polices and token settings can all be configured
		using this endpoint

allowed_redirect_uris.description: Comma-separated list of allowed values for redirect_uri

bound_audiences.description: Comma-separated list of 'aud' claims that are valid for login; any match is sufficient

bound_cidrs.description: Use "token_bound_cidrs" instead. If this and "token_bound_cidrs" are both specified, only "token_bound_cidrs" will be used.

bound_claims.description: Map of claims/values which must match for login

bound_subject.description: The 'sub' claim that is valid for login. Optional.

claim_mappings.description: Mappings of claims (key) that will be copied to a metadata field (value)

clock_skew_leeway.description: Duration in seconds of leeway when validating all claims to account for clock skew. Defaults to 60 (1 minute) if set to 0 and can be disabled if set to -1.

expiration_leeway.description: Duration in seconds of leeway when validating expiration of a token to account for clock skew. Defaults to 150 (2.5 minutes) if set to 0 and can be disabled if set to -1.

groups_claim.description: The claim to use for the Identity group alias names

max_ttl.description: Use "token_max_ttl" instead. If this and "token_max_ttl" are both specified, only "token_max_ttl" will be used.

not_before_leeway.description: Duration in seconds of leeway when validating not before values of a token to account for clock skew. Defaults to 150 (2.5 minutes) if set to 0 and can be disabled if set to -1.

num_uses.description: Use "token_num_uses" instead. If this and "token_num_uses" are both specified, only "token_num_uses" will be used.

period.description: Use "token_period" instead. If this and "token_period" are both specified, only "token_period" will be used.

policies.description: Use "token_policies" instead. If this and "token_policies" are both specified, only "token_policies" will be used.

role_type.description: Type of the role, either 'jwt' or 'oidc'.

token_bound_cidrs.description: Comma separated string or JSON list of CIDR blocks. If set, specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token.

token_explicit_max_ttl.description: If set, tokens created via this role carry an explicit maximum TTL. During renewal, the current maximum TTL values of the role and the mount are not checked for changes, and any updates to these values will have no effect on the token being renewed.

token_max_ttl.description: The maximum lifetime of the generated token

token_no_default_policy.description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

x-vault-displayAttrs.name: Do Not Attach 'default' Policy To Generated Tokens

token_num_uses.description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_period.description: If set, tokens created via this role will have no max lifetime; instead, their renewal period will be fixed to this value. This takes an integer number of seconds, or a string duration (e.g. "24h").

token_ttl.description: The initial ttl of the token to generate

token_type.description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

ttl.description: Use "token_ttl" instead. If this and "token_ttl" are both specified, only "token_ttl" will be used.

user_claim.description: The claim to use for the Identity entity alias name

verbose_oidc_logging.description: Log received OIDC tokens and claims when debug-level logging is active. Not recommended in production since sensitive information may be present in OIDC responses.

delete.summary: Delete an existing role.

/auth/token/accessors/.description: List token accessors, which can then be be used to iterate and discover their properties or revoke them. Because this can be used to cause a denial of service, this endpoint requires 'sudo' capability in addition to 'list'.

get.summary:
List token accessors, which can then be
be used to iterate and discover their properties
or revoke them. Because this can be used to
cause a denial of service, this endpoint
requires 'sudo' capability in addition to
'list'.

/auth/token/create.description: The token create path is used to create new tokens.

post.summary: The token create path is used to create new tokens.

/auth/token/create-orphan.description: The token create path is used to create new orphan tokens.

post.summary: The token create path is used to create new orphan tokens.

/auth/token/create/{role_name}.description: This token create path is used to create new tokens adhering to the given role.

post.summary: This token create path is used to create new tokens adhering to the given role.

/auth/token/lookup.description: This endpoint will lookup a token and its properties.

get.summary: This endpoint will lookup a token and its properties.

post.summary: This endpoint will lookup a token and its properties.

/auth/token/lookup-accessor.description: This endpoint will lookup a token associated with the given accessor and its properties. Response will not contain the token ID.

post.summary: This endpoint will lookup a token associated with the given accessor and its properties. Response will not contain the token ID.

accessor.description: Accessor of the token to look up (request body)

/auth/token/lookup-self.description: This endpoint will lookup a token and its properties.

get.summary: This endpoint will lookup a token and its properties.

post.summary: This endpoint will lookup a token and its properties.

token.description: Token to look up (unused, does not need to be set)

/auth/token/renew.description: This endpoint will renew the given token and prevent expiration.

post.summary: This endpoint will renew the given token and prevent expiration.

increment.description: The desired increment in seconds to the token expiration

/auth/token/renew-self.description: This endpoint will renew the token used to call it and prevent expiration.

post.summary: This endpoint will renew the token used to call it and prevent expiration.

increment.description: The desired increment in seconds to the token expiration

token.description: Token to renew (unused, does not need to be set)

/auth/token/revoke.description: This endpoint will delete the given token and all of its child tokens.

post.summary: This endpoint will delete the given token and all of its child tokens.

/auth/token/revoke-accessor.description: This endpoint will delete the token associated with the accessor and all of its child tokens.

post.summary: This endpoint will delete the token associated with the accessor and all of its child tokens.

/auth/token/revoke-orphan.description: This endpoint will delete the token and orphan its child tokens.

post.summary: This endpoint will delete the token and orphan its child tokens.

/auth/token/revoke-self.description: This endpoint will delete the token used to call it and all of its child tokens.

post.summary: This endpoint will delete the token used to call it and all of its child tokens.

get.summary: This endpoint lists configured roles.

allowed_entity_aliases.description: String or JSON list of allowed entity aliases. If set, specifies the entity aliases which are allowed to be used during token generation. This field supports globbing.

allowed_policies.description: If set, tokens can be created with any subset of the policies in this list, rather than the normal semantics of tokens being a subset of the calling token's policies. The parameter is a comma-delimited string of policy names.

disallowed_policies.description: If set, successful token creation via this role will require that no policies in the given list are requested. The parameter is a comma-delimited string of policy names.

orphan.description: If true, tokens created via this role will be orphan tokens (have no parent)

path_suffix.description: If set, tokens created via this role will contain the given suffix as a part of their path. This can be used to assist use of the 'revoke-prefix' endpoint later on. The given suffix must match the regular expression.\w[\w-.]+\w

renewable.description: Tokens created via this role will be renewable or not according to this value. Defaults to "true".

token_bound_cidrs.description: Comma separated string or JSON list of CIDR blocks. If set, specifies the blocks of IP addresses which are allowed to use the generated token.

token_explicit_max_ttl.description: If set, tokens created via this role carry an explicit maximum TTL. During renewal, the current maximum TTL values of the role and the mount are not checked for changes, and any updates to these values will have no effect on the token being renewed.

token_no_default_policy.description: If true, the 'default' policy will not automatically be added to generated tokens

x-vault-displayAttrs.name: Do Not Attach 'default' Policy To Generated Tokens

token_num_uses.description: The maximum number of times a token may be used, a value of zero means unlimited

token_period.description: If set, tokens created via this role will have no max lifetime; instead, their renewal period will be fixed to this value. This takes an integer number of seconds, or a string duration (e.g. "24h").

token_type.description: The type of token to generate, service or batch

/auth/token/tidy.description: This endpoint performs cleanup tasks that can be run if certain error conditions have occurred.

post.summary:
This endpoint performs cleanup tasks that can be run if certain error
conditions have occurred.

/cubbyhole/{path}.description: Pass-through secret storage to a token-specific cubbyhole in the storage backend, allowing you to read/write arbitrary data into secret storage.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Specifies the path of the secret.

get.summary: Retrieve the secret at the specified location.

post.summary: Store a secret at the specified location.

delete.summary: Deletes the secret at the specified location.

post.summary: Create a new alias.

canonical_id.description: Entity ID to which this alias belongs to

entity_id.description: Entity ID to which this alias belongs to. This field is deprecated in favor of 'canonical_id'.

mount_accessor.description: Mount accessor to which this alias belongs to

get.summary: List all the alias IDs.

/identity/alias/id/{id}.description: Update, read or delete an alias ID.

get.summary: Update, read or delete an alias ID.

post.summary: Update, read or delete an alias ID.

canonical_id.description: Entity ID to which this alias should be tied to

entity_id.description: Entity ID to which this alias should be tied to. This field is deprecated in favor of 'canonical_id'.

mount_accessor.description: Mount accessor to which this alias belongs to

delete.summary: Update, read or delete an alias ID.

post.summary: Create a new entity

disabled.description: If set true, tokens tied to this identity will not be able to be used (but will not be revoked).

id.description: ID of the entity. If set, updates the corresponding existing entity.

metadata.description: Metadata to be associated with the entity. In CLI, this parameter can be repeated multiple times, and it all gets merged together. For example: vault <command> <path> metadata=key1=value1 metadata=key2=value2

policies.description: Policies to be tied to the entity.

post.summary: Create a new alias.

canonical_id.description: Entity ID to which this alias belongs

entity_id.description: Entity ID to which this alias belongs. This field is deprecated, use canonical_id.

id.description: ID of the entity alias. If set, updates the corresponding entity alias.

mount_accessor.description: Mount accessor to which this alias belongs to; unused for a modify

name.description: Name of the alias; unused for a modify

get.summary: List all the alias IDs.

/identity/entity-alias/id/{id}.description: Update, read or delete an alias ID.

get.summary: Update, read or delete an alias ID.

post.summary: Update, read or delete an alias ID.

canonical_id.description: Entity ID to which this alias should be tied to

entity_id.description: Entity ID to which this alias belongs to. This field is deprecated, use canonical_id.

delete.summary: Update, read or delete an alias ID.

get.summary: List all the entity IDs

/identity/entity/id/{id}.description: Update, read or delete an entity using entity ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the entity. If set, updates the corresponding existing entity.

get.summary: Update, read or delete an entity using entity ID

post.summary: Update, read or delete an entity using entity ID

disabled.description: If set true, tokens tied to this identity will not be able to be used (but will not be revoked).

metadata.description: Metadata to be associated with the entity. In CLI, this parameter can be repeated multiple times, and it all gets merged together. For example: vault <command> <path> metadata=key1=value1 metadata=key2=value2

policies.description: Policies to be tied to the entity.

delete.summary: Update, read or delete an entity using entity ID

/identity/entity/merge.description: Merge two or more entities together

post.summary: Merge two or more entities together

force.description: Setting this will follow the 'mine' strategy for merging MFA secrets. If there are secrets of the same type both in entities that are merged from and in entity into which all others are getting merged, secrets in the destination will be unaltered. If not set, this API will throw an error containing all the conflicts.

from_entity_ids.description: Entity IDs which needs to get merged

to_entity_id.description: Entity ID into which all the other entities need to get merged

get.summary: List all the entity names

/identity/entity/name/{name}.description: Update, read or delete an entity using entity name

get.summary: Update, read or delete an entity using entity name

post.summary: Update, read or delete an entity using entity name

disabled.description: If set true, tokens tied to this identity will not be able to be used (but will not be revoked).

id.description: ID of the entity. If set, updates the corresponding existing entity.

metadata.description: Metadata to be associated with the entity. In CLI, this parameter can be repeated multiple times, and it all gets merged together. For example: vault <command> <path> metadata=key1=value1 metadata=key2=value2

policies.description: Policies to be tied to the entity.

delete.summary: Update, read or delete an entity using entity name

post.summary: Create a new group.

id.description: ID of the group. If set, updates the corresponding existing group.

member_entity_ids.description: Entity IDs to be assigned as group members.

member_group_ids.description: Group IDs to be assigned as group members.

metadata.description: Metadata to be associated with the group. In CLI, this parameter can be repeated multiple times, and it all gets merged together. For example: vault <command> <path> metadata=key1=value1 metadata=key2=value2

policies.description: Policies to be tied to the group.

type.description: Type of the group, 'internal' or 'external'. Defaults to 'internal'

policies.description: Policies to be tied to the group.

/identity/lookup/entity.description: Query entities based on various properties.

post.summary: Query entities based on various properties.

alias_mount_accessor.description: Accessor of the mount to which the alias belongs to. This should be supplied in conjunction with 'alias_name'.

alias_name.description: Name of the alias. This should be supplied in conjunction with 'alias_mount_accessor'.

/identity/lookup/group.description: Query groups based on various properties.

get.summary: Retrieve public keys
Query OIDC configurations
OIDC configuration

post.summary: OIDC configuration

issuer.description: Issuer URL to be used in the iss claim of the token. If not set, Vault's app_addr will be used.

/identity/oidc/introspect.description: Verify the authenticity of an OIDC token

post.summary: Verify the authenticity of an OIDC token

get.summary: List OIDC keys
CRUD operations for OIDC keys.

post.summary: CRUD operations for OIDC keys.

algorithm.description: Signing algorithm to use. This will default to RS256.

allowed_client_ids.description: Comma separated string or array of role client ids allowed to use this key for signing. If empty no roles are allowed. If "*" all roles are allowed.

rotation_period.description: How often to generate a new keypair.

verification_ttl.description: Controls how long the public portion of a key will be available for verification after being rotated.

delete.summary: CRUD operations for OIDC keys.

post.summary: Rotate a named OIDC key.

verification_ttl.description: Controls how long the public portion of a key will be available for verification after being rotated. Setting verification_ttl here will override the verification_ttl set on the key.

get.summary: List configured OIDC roles
CRUD operations on OIDC Roles

post.summary: CRUD operations on OIDC Roles

key.description: The OIDC key to use for generating tokens. The specified key must already exist.

template.description: The template string to use for generating tokens. This may be in string-ified JSON or base64 format.

ttl.description: TTL of the tokens generated against the role.

delete.summary: CRUD operations on OIDC Roles

get.summary: Generate an OIDC token

post.summary: Create a new alias.

entity_id.description: Entity ID to which this persona belongs to

metadata.description: Metadata to be associated with the persona. In CLI, this parameter can be repeated multiple times, and it all gets merged together. For example: vault <command> <path> metadata=key1=value1 metadata=key2=value2

mount_accessor.description: Mount accessor to which this persona belongs to

get.summary: List all the alias IDs.

/identity/persona/id/{id}.description: Update, read or delete an alias ID.

get.summary: Update, read or delete an alias ID.

post.summary: Update, read or delete an alias ID.

entity_id.description: Entity ID to which this persona should be tied to

metadata.description: Metadata to be associated with the persona. In CLI, this parameter can be repeated multiple times, and it all gets merged together. For example: vault <command> <path> metadata=key1=value1 metadata=key2=value2

mount_accessor.description: Mount accessor to which this persona belongs to

delete.summary: Update, read or delete an alias ID.

/kv/config.description: Configures settings for the KV store

get.summary: Read the backend level settings.

post.summary: Configure backend level settings that are applied to every key in the key-value store.

cas_required.description: If true, the backend will require the cas parameter to be set for each write

delete_version_after.description: If set, the length of time before a version is deleted. A negative duration disables the use of delete_version_after on all keys. A zero duration clears the current setting. Accepts a Go duration format string.

max_versions.description: The number of versions to keep for each key. Defaults to 10

/kv/data/{path}.description: Write, Read, and Delete data in the Key-Value Store.

get.summary: Write, Read, and Delete data in the Key-Value Store.

post.summary: Write, Read, and Delete data in the Key-Value Store.

data.description: The contents of the data map will be stored and returned on read.

options.description: Options for writing a KV entry. Set the "cas" value to use a Check-And-Set operation. If not set the write will be allowed. If set to 0 a write will only be allowed if the key doesnt exist. If the index is non-zero the write will only be allowed if the keys current version matches the version specified in the cas parameter.

version.description: If provided during a read, the value at the version number will be returned

delete.summary: Write, Read, and Delete data in the Key-Value Store.

/kv/delete/{path}.description: Marks one or more versions as deleted in the KV store.

post.summary: Marks one or more versions as deleted in the KV store.

versions.description: The versions to be archived. The versioned data will not be deleted, but it will no longer be returned in normal get requests.

/kv/destroy/{path}.description: Permanently removes one or more versions in the KV store

post.summary: Permanently removes one or more versions in the KV store

versions.description: The versions to destroy. Their data will be permanently deleted.

/kv/metadata/{path}.description: Configures settings for the KV store

get.summary: Configures settings for the KV store

post.summary: Configures settings for the KV store

cas_required.description: If true the key will require the cas parameter to be set on all write requests. If false, the backends configuration will be used.

delete_version_after.description: The length of time before a version is deleted. If not set, the backend's configured delete_version_after is used. Cannot be greater than the backend's delete_version_after. A zero duration clears the current setting. A negative duration will cause an error.

max_versions.description: The number of versions to keep. If not set, the backends configured max version is used.

delete.summary: Configures settings for the KV store

/kv/undelete/{path}.description: Undeletes one or more versions from the KV store.

post.summary: Undeletes one or more versions from the KV store.

versions.description: The versions to unarchive. The versions will be restored and their data will be returned on normal get requests.

/sys/audit.description: List the currently enabled audit backends.

get.summary: List the enabled audit devices.

/sys/audit-hash/{path}.description: The hash of the given string via the given audit backend

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The name of the backend. Cannot be delimited. Example: "mysql"

post.summary: The hash of the given string via the given audit backend

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The name of the backend. Cannot be delimited. Example: "mysql"

post.summary: Enable a new audit device at the supplied path.

description.description: User-friendly description for this audit backend.

local.description: Mark the mount as a local mount, which is not replicated and is unaffected by replication.

options.description: Configuration options for the audit backend.

type.description: The type of the backend. Example: "mysql"

delete.summary: Disable the audit device at the given path.

/sys/auth.description: List the currently enabled credential backends.

get.summary: List the currently enabled credential backends.

/sys/auth/{path}.description: Enable a new credential backend with a name.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to mount to. Cannot be delimited. Example: "user"

post.summary: Enables a new auth method.
post.description:
After enabling, the auth method can be accessed and configured via the auth path specified as part of the URL. This auth path will be nested under the auth prefix.

For example, enable the "foo" auth method will make it accessible at /auth/foo.

config.description: Configuration for this mount, such as plugin_name.

description.description: User-friendly description for this credential backend.

local.description: Mark the mount as a local mount, which is not replicated and is unaffected by replication.

options.description: The options to pass into the backend. Should be a json object with string keys and values.

plugin_name.description: Name of the auth plugin to use based from the name in the plugin catalog.

seal_wrap.description: Whether to turn on seal wrapping for the mount.

type.description: The type of the backend. Example: "userpass"

delete.summary: Disable the auth method at the given auth path

/sys/auth/{path}/tune.description: Tune the configuration parameters for an auth path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Tune the configuration parameters for an auth path.

get.summary: Reads the given auth path's configuration.
get.description: This endpoint requires sudo capability on the final path, but the same functionality can be achieved without sudo via `sys/mounts/auth/[auth-path]/tune`.

post.summary: Tune configuration parameters for a given auth path.
post.description: This endpoint requires sudo capability on the final path, but the same functionality can be achieved without sudo via `sys/mounts/auth/[auth-path]/tune`.

allowed_response_headers.description: A list of headers to whitelist and allow a plugin to set on responses.

audit_non_hmac_request_keys.description: The list of keys in the request data object that will not be HMAC'ed by audit devices.

audit_non_hmac_response_keys.description: The list of keys in the response data object that will not be HMAC'ed by audit devices.

default_lease_ttl.description: The default lease TTL for this mount.

description.description: User-friendly description for this credential backend.

listing_visibility.description: Determines the visibility of the mount in the UI-specific listing endpoint. Accepted value are 'unauth' and ''.

max_lease_ttl.description: The max lease TTL for this mount.

options.description: The options to pass into the backend. Should be a json object with string keys and values.

passthrough_request_headers.description: A list of headers to whitelist and pass from the request to the plugin.

token_type.description: The type of token to issue (service or batch).

/sys/capabilities.description: Fetches the capabilities of the given token on the given path.

post.summary: Fetches the capabilities of the given token on the given path.

paths.description: Paths on which capabilities are being queried.

token.description: Token for which capabilities are being queried.

/sys/capabilities-accessor.description: Fetches the capabilities of the token associated with the given token, on the given path.

post.summary: Fetches the capabilities of the token associated with the given token, on the given path.

accessor.description: Accessor of the token for which capabilities are being queried.

paths.description: Paths on which capabilities are being queried.

/sys/capabilities-self.description: Fetches the capabilities of the given token on the given path.

post.summary: Fetches the capabilities of the given token on the given path.

paths.description: Paths on which capabilities are being queried.

token.description: Token for which capabilities are being queried.

/sys/config/auditing/request-headers.description: Lists the headers configured to be audited.

get.summary: List the request headers that are configured to be audited.

/sys/config/auditing/request-headers/{he.description: Configures the headers sent to the audit logs.

get.summary: List the information for the given request header.

post.summary: Enable auditing of a header.

delete.summary: Disable auditing of the given request header.

get.summary: Configure control group global settings.

post.summary: Configure control group global settings.

max_ttl.description: The max TTL for a control group token.

delete.summary: Configure control group global settings.

/sys/config/cors.description: This path responds to the following HTTP methods. GET / Returns the configuration of the CORS setting. POST / Sets the comma-separated list of origins that can make cross-origin requests. DELETE / Clears the CORS configuration and disables acceptance of CORS requests.

get.summary: Return the current CORS settings.

post.summary: Configure the CORS settings.

allowed_headers.description: A comma-separated string or array of strings indicating headers that are allowed on cross-origin requests.

allowed_origins.description: A comma-separated string or array of strings indicating origins that may make cross-origin requests.

enable.description: Enables or disables CORS headers on requests.

delete.summary: Remove any CORS settings.

/sys/config/ui/headers/.description: This path responds to the following HTTP methods. GET /<header> Returns the header value. POST /<header> Sets the header value for the UI. DELETE /<header> Clears the header value for UI. LIST / List the headers configured for the UI.

get.summary: Return a list of configured UI headers.

/sys/config/ui/headers/{header}.description: This path responds to the following HTTP methods. GET /<header> Returns the header value. POST /<header> Sets the header value for the UI. DELETE /<header> Clears the header value for UI. LIST / List the headers configured for the UI.

get.summary: Return the given UI header's configuration

post.summary: Configure the values to be returned for the UI header.

values.description: The values to set the header.

delete.summary: Remove a UI header.

post.summary: Authorize a control group request

accessor.description: The accessor of the request to authorize.

/sys/control-group/request.description: Check the status of a control group request

post.summary: Check the status of a control group request

/sys/generate-root.description: Reads, generates, or deletes a root token regeneration process.

get.summary: Read the configuration and progress of the current root generation attempt.

post.summary: Initializes a new root generation attempt.
post.description: Only a single root generation attempt can take place at a time. One (and only one) of otp or pgp_key are required.

pgp_key.description: Specifies a base64-encoded PGP public key.

delete.summary: Cancels any in-progress root generation attempt.

/sys/generate-root/attempt.description: Reads, generates, or deletes a root token regeneration process.

get.summary: Read the configuration and progress of the current root generation attempt.

post.summary: Initializes a new root generation attempt.
post.description: Only a single root generation attempt can take place at a time. One (and only one) of otp or pgp_key are required.

pgp_key.description: Specifies a base64-encoded PGP public key.

delete.summary: Cancels any in-progress root generation attempt.

/sys/generate-root/update.description: Reads, generates, or deletes a root token regeneration process.

post.summary: Enter a single master key share to progress the root generation attempt.
post.description: If the threshold number of master key shares is reached, Vault will complete the root generation and issue the new token. Otherwise, this API must be called multiple times until that threshold is met. The attempt nonce must be provided with each call.

key.description: Specifies a single master key share.

nonce.description: Specifies the nonce of the attempt.

get.summary: Returns the health status of Vault.

472.description: data recovery mode replication secondary and active

/sys/init.description: Initializes or returns the initialization status of the Vault.

get.summary: Returns the initialization status of Vault.

post.summary: Initialize a new Vault.
post.description: The Vault must not have been previously initialized. The recovery options, as well as the stored shares option, are only available when using Vault HSM.

pgp_keys.description: Specifies an array of PGP public keys used to encrypt the output unseal keys. Ordering is preserved. The keys must be base64-encoded from their original binary representation. The size of this array must be the same as `secret_shares`.

recovery_pgp_keys.description: Specifies an array of PGP public keys used to encrypt the output recovery keys. Ordering is preserved. The keys must be base64-encoded from their original binary representation. The size of this array must be the same as `recovery_shares`.

recovery_shares.description: Specifies the number of shares to split the recovery key into.

recovery_threshold.description: Specifies the number of shares required to reconstruct the recovery key. This must be less than or equal to `recovery_shares`.

root_token_pgp_key.description: Specifies a PGP public key used to encrypt the initial root token. The key must be base64-encoded from its original binary representation.

secret_shares.description: Specifies the number of shares to split the master key into.

secret_threshold.description: Specifies the number of shares required to reconstruct the master key. This must be less than or equal secret_shares. If using Vault HSM with auto-unsealing, this value must be the same as `secret_shares`.

stored_shares.description: Specifies the number of shares that should be encrypted by the HSM and stored for auto-unsealing. Currently must be the same as `secret_shares`.

/sys/internal/counters/requests.description: Count of requests seen by this Vault cluster over time.

get.summary: Generate an OpenAPI 3 document of all mounted paths.

/sys/internal/ui/namespaces.description: Information about visible child namespaces. Internal API; its location, inputs, and outputs may change.

/sys/internal/ui/resultant-acl.description: Information about a token's resultant ACL. Internal API; its location, inputs, and outputs may change.

post.summary: Revokes a lease immediately.

lease_id.description: The lease identifier to renew. This is included with a lease.

sync.description: Whether or not to perform the revocation synchronously

url_lease_id.description: The lease identifier to renew. This is included with a lease.

/sys/leases/revoke-force/{prefix}.description: Revoke all secrets generated in a given prefix, ignoring errors.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: The path to revoke keys under. Example: "prod/aws/ops"

post.summary: Revokes all secrets or tokens generated under a given prefix immediately
post.description:
Unlike `/sys/leases/revoke-prefix`, this path ignores backend errors encountered during revocation. This is potentially very dangerous and should only be used in specific emergency situations where errors in the backend or the connected backend service prevent normal revocation.

By ignoring these errors, Vault abdicates responsibility for ensuring that the issued credentials or secrets are properly revoked and/or cleaned up. Access to this endpoint should be tightly controlled.

/sys/leases/revoke-prefix/{prefix}.description: Revoke all secrets generated in a given prefix

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: The path to revoke keys under. Example: "prod/aws/ops"

post.summary: Revokes all secrets (via a lease ID prefix) or tokens (via the tokens' path property) generated under a given prefix immediately.

sync.description: Whether or not to perform the revocation synchronously

parameters.name: url_lease_id
parameters.description: The lease identifier to renew. This is included with a lease.

post.summary: Revokes a lease immediately.

lease_id.description: The lease identifier to renew. This is included with a lease.

sync.description: Whether or not to perform the revocation synchronously

parameters.description: Format to export metrics into. Currently accepts only "prometheus".

/sys/mfa/method.description: Lists all the available MFA methods by their name.

get.summary: Lists all the available MFA methods by their name.

/sys/mfa/method/duo/{name}.description: Defines or updates a Duo MFA method.

get.summary: Defines or updates a Duo MFA method.

post.summary: Defines or updates a Duo MFA method.

mount_accessor.description: The mount to tie this method to for use in automatic mappings. The mapping will use the Name field of Aliases associated with this mount as the username in the mapping.

username_format.description: A format string for mapping Identity names to MFA method names. Values to subtitute should be placed in {{}}. For example, "{{alias.name}}@example.com". Currently-supported mappings: alias.name: The name returned by the mount configured via the mount_accessor parameter If blank, the Alias's name field will be used as-is.

delete.summary: Defines or updates a Duo MFA method.

/sys/mfa/method/okta/{name}.description: Defines or updates an Okta MFA method.

get.summary: Defines or updates an Okta MFA method.

post.summary: Defines or updates an Okta MFA method.

base_url.description: The base domain to use for the Okta API. When not specified in the configuration, "okta.com" is used.

mount_accessor.description: The mount to tie this method to for use in automatic mappings. The mapping will use the Name field of Aliases associated with this mount as the username in the mapping.

org_name.description: Name of the organization to be used in the Okta API.

primary_email.description: If true, the username will only match the primary email for the account. Defaults to false.

username_format.description: A format string for mapping Identity names to MFA method names. Values to subtitute should be placed in {{}}. For example, "{{alias.name}}@example.com". Currently-supported mappings: alias.name: The name returned by the mount configured via the mount_accessor parameter If blank, the Alias's name field will be used as-is.

delete.summary: Defines or updates an Okta MFA method.

/sys/mfa/method/pingid/{name}.description: Defines or updates a PingID MFA method.

get.summary: Defines or updates a PingID MFA method.

post.summary: Defines or updates a PingID MFA method.

mount_accessor.description: The mount to tie this method to for use in automatic mappings. The mapping will use the Name field of Aliases associated with this mount as the username in the mapping.

settings_file_base64.description: The settings file provided by Ping, Base64-encoded. This must be a settings file suitable for third-party clients, not the PingID SDK or PingFederate.

username_format.description: A format string for mapping Identity names to MFA method names. Values to subtitute should be placed in {{}}. For example, "{{alias.name}}@example.com". Currently-supported mappings: alias.name: The name returned by the mount configured via the mount_accessor parameter If blank, the Alias's name field will be used as-is.

delete.summary: Defines or updates a PingID MFA method.

/sys/mfa/method/totp/{name}.description: Defines or updates a TOTP MFA method.

get.summary: Defines or updates a TOTP MFA method.

post.summary: Defines or updates a TOTP MFA method.

algorithm.description: The hashing algorithm used to generate the TOTP token. Options include SHA1, SHA256 and SHA512.

digits.description: The number of digits in the generated TOTP token. This value can either be 6 or 8.

issuer.description: The name of the key's issuing organization.

key_size.description: Determines the size in bytes of the generated key.

period.description: The length of time used to generate a counter for the TOTP token calculation.

qr_size.description: The pixel size of the generated square QR code.

skew.description: The number of delay periods that are allowed when validating a TOTP token. This value can either be 0 or 1.

delete.summary: Defines or updates a TOTP MFA method.

/sys/mfa/method/totp/{name}/admin-destro.description: Deletes the TOTP secret for the given method name on the given entity.

post.summary: Deletes the TOTP secret for the given method name on the given entity.

entity_id.description: Identifier of the entity from which the MFA method secret needs to be removed.

/sys/mfa/method/totp/{name}/admin-genera.description: Generates a TOTP secret for the given method name on the given entity.

post.summary: Generates a TOTP secret for the given method name on the given entity.

entity_id.description: Entity ID on which the generated secret needs to get stored.

/sys/mfa/method/totp/{name}/generate.description: Generates a TOTP secret for the given method name on the entity of the calling token.

get.summary:
Generates a TOTP secret for the given method name on the entity of the
		calling token.
List the currently mounted backends.

/sys/mounts/{path}.description: Mount a new backend at a new path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to mount to. Example: "aws/east"

post.summary: Enable a new secrets engine at the given path.

config.description: Configuration for this mount, such as default_lease_ttl and max_lease_ttl.

local.description: Mark the mount as a local mount, which is not replicated and is unaffected by replication.

options.description: The options to pass into the backend. Should be a json object with string keys and values.

plugin_name.description: Name of the plugin to mount based from the name registered in the plugin catalog.

seal_wrap.description: Whether to turn on seal wrapping for the mount.

type.description: The type of the backend. Example: "passthrough"

delete.summary: Disable the mount point specified at the given path.

/sys/mounts/{path}/tune.description: Tune backend configuration parameters for this mount.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to mount to. Example: "aws/east"

get.summary: Tune backend configuration parameters for this mount.

post.summary: Tune backend configuration parameters for this mount.

allowed_response_headers.description: A list of headers to whitelist and allow a plugin to set on responses.

audit_non_hmac_request_keys.description: The list of keys in the request data object that will not be HMAC'ed by audit devices.

audit_non_hmac_response_keys.description: The list of keys in the response data object that will not be HMAC'ed by audit devices.

default_lease_ttl.description: The default lease TTL for this mount.

description.description: User-friendly description for this credential backend.

listing_visibility.description: Determines the visibility of the mount in the UI-specific listing endpoint. Accepted value are 'unauth' and ''.

max_lease_ttl.description: The max lease TTL for this mount.

options.description: The options to pass into the backend. Should be a json object with string keys and values.

passthrough_request_headers.description: A list of headers to whitelist and pass from the request to the plugin.

token_type.description: The type of token to issue (service or batch).

args.description: The args passed to plugin command.

command.description: The command used to start the plugin. The executable defined in this command must exist in vault's plugin directory.

env.description: The environment variables passed to plugin command. Each entry is of the form "key=value".

sha256.description: The SHA256 sum of the executable used in the command field. This should be HEX encoded.

sha_256.description: The SHA256 sum of the executable used in the command field. This should be HEX encoded.

type.description: The type of the plugin, may be auth, secret, or database

delete.summary: Remove the plugin with the given name.

get.summary: Return the configuration data for the plugin with the given name.

args.description: The args passed to plugin command.

command.description: The command used to start the plugin. The executable defined in this command must exist in vault's plugin directory.

env.description: The environment variables passed to plugin command. Each entry is of the form "key=value".

sha256.description: The SHA256 sum of the executable used in the command field. This should be HEX encoded.

sha_256.description: The SHA256 sum of the executable used in the command field. This should be HEX encoded.

delete.summary: Remove the plugin with the given name.

/sys/plugins/reload/backend.description: Reload mounts that use a particular backend plugin.

post.summary: Reload mounted plugin backends.
post.description: Either the plugin name (`plugin`) or the desired plugin backend mounts (`mounts`) must be provided, but not both. In the case that the plugin name is provided, all mounted paths that use that plugin backend will be reloaded.

mounts.description: The mount paths of the plugin backends to reload.

plugin.description: The name of the plugin to reload, as registered in the plugin catalog.

/sys/rekey/backup.description: Allows fetching or deleting the backup of the rotated unseal keys.

get.summary: Return the backup copy of PGP-encrypted unseal keys.

delete.summary: Delete the backup copy of PGP-encrypted unseal keys.

get.summary: Reads the configuration and progress of the current rekey attempt.

post.summary: Initializes a new rekey attempt.
post.description: Only a single rekey attempt can take place at a time, and changing the parameters of a rekey requires canceling and starting a new rekey, which will also provide a new nonce.

backup.description: Specifies if using PGP-encrypted keys, whether Vault should also store a plaintext backup of the PGP-encrypted keys.

pgp_keys.description: Specifies an array of PGP public keys used to encrypt the output unseal keys. Ordering is preserved. The keys must be base64-encoded from their original binary representation. The size of this array must be the same as secret_shares.

secret_shares.description: Specifies the number of shares to split the master key into.

secret_threshold.description: Specifies the number of shares required to reconstruct the master key. This must be less than or equal secret_shares. If using Vault HSM with auto-unsealing, this value must be the same as secret_shares.

delete.summary: Cancels any in-progress rekey.
delete.description: This clears the rekey settings as well as any progress made. This must be called to change the parameters of the rekey. Note: verification is still a part of a rekey. If rekeying is canceled during the verification flow, the current unseal keys remain valid.

/sys/rekey/recovery-key-backup.description: Allows fetching or deleting the backup of the rotated unseal keys.

get.summary: Allows fetching or deleting the backup of the rotated unseal keys.

delete.summary: Allows fetching or deleting the backup of the rotated unseal keys.

post.summary: Enter a single master key share to progress the rekey of the Vault.

key.description: Specifies a single master key share.

nonce.description: Specifies the nonce of the rekey attempt.

get.summary: Read the configuration and progress of the current rekey verification attempt.

post.summary: Enter a single new key share to progress the rekey verification operation.

key.description: Specifies a single master share key from the new set of shares.

nonce.description: Specifies the nonce of the rekey verification operation.

delete.summary: Cancel any in-progress rekey verification operation.
delete.description: This clears any progress made and resets the nonce. Unlike a `DELETE` against `sys/rekey/init`, this only resets the current verification operation, not the entire rekey atttempt.

primary_cluster_addr.description: The address the secondary cluster should connect to. Defaults to the primary's cluster address.

id.description: The secondary cluster ID to revoke
An opaque identifier that can be used to identify and revoke a secondary cluster's access later.

secondary_public_key.description: A base64-encoded public key generated by the secondary cluster.

ttl.description: The TTL to use for the secondary activation token. Defaults to 30 minutes.

ca_file.description: A path to a file containing a PEM-encoded CA certificate to verify the call against the primary's API address

ca_path.description: A path to a directory containing PEM-encoded CA certificates to verify the call against the primary's API address

client_cert_pem.description: The client certificate to use for authentication, in PEM format. Note: client authentication for this operation will always use TLS 1.2 or higher.

client_key_pem.description: The client key to use for authentication, in PEM format.

primary_api_addr.description: The API address of the primary. If not set, the value the primary supplies in the token will be used, which is the primary's redirect address.

token.description: The token given by the primary to activate secondary status for this cluster.

id.description: The secondary cluster ID to revoke
An opaque identifier that can be used to identify and revoke a secondary cluster's access later.

secondary_public_key.description: A base64-encoded public key generated by the secondary cluster.

ttl.description: The TTL to use for the secondary activation token. Defaults to 30 minutes.

diff.description: Enables a slower re-indexing which will perform a key level check to diagnose issues. Defaults false.

force.description: Forces a complete re-indexing which only scans data available in the storage. Defaults false.

ca_file.description: A path to a file containing a PEM-encoded CA certificate to verify the call against the primary's API address

ca_path.description: A path to a directory containing PEM-encoded CA certificates to verify the call against the primary's API address

client_cert_pem.description: The client certificate to use for authentication, in PEM format. Note: client authentication for this operation will always use TLS 1.2 or higher.

client_key_pem.description: The client key to use for authentication, in PEM format.

primary_api_addr.description: The API address of the primary. If not set, the value the primary supplies in the token will be used, which is the primary's redirect address.

token.description: The token given by the primary to activate secondary status for this cluster.

force.description: Set to true if the cluster should be promoted despite replication being in an error state. This could mean some data was not replicated to the secondary

primary_cluster_addr.description: The address the secondary cluster should connect to. Defaults to the primary's cluster address.

ca_file.description: A path to a file containing a PEM-encoded CA certificate to verify the call against the primary's API address

ca_path.description: A path to a directory containing PEM-encoded CA certificates to verify the call against the primary's API address

client_cert_pem.description: The client certificate to use for authentication, in PEM format. Note: client authentication for this operation will always use TLS 1.2 or higher.

client_key_pem.description: The client key to use for authentication, in PEM format.

primary_api_addr.description: The API address of the primary. If not set, the value the primary supplies in the token will be used, which is the primary's redirect address.

token.description: The token given by the primary to activate secondary status for this cluster.

post.summary: Revokes a lease immediately.

lease_id.description: The lease identifier to renew. This is included with a lease.

sync.description: Whether or not to perform the revocation synchronously

url_lease_id.description: The lease identifier to renew. This is included with a lease.

/sys/revoke-force/{prefix}.description: Revoke all secrets generated in a given prefix, ignoring errors.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: The path to revoke keys under. Example: "prod/aws/ops"

post.summary: Revokes all secrets or tokens generated under a given prefix immediately
post.description:
Unlike `/sys/leases/revoke-prefix`, this path ignores backend errors encountered during revocation. This is potentially very dangerous and should only be used in specific emergency situations where errors in the backend or the connected backend service prevent normal revocation.

By ignoring these errors, Vault abdicates responsibility for ensuring that the issued credentials or secrets are properly revoked and/or cleaned up. Access to this endpoint should be tightly controlled.

/sys/revoke-prefix/{prefix}.description: Revoke all secrets generated in a given prefix

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: The path to revoke keys under. Example: "prod/aws/ops"

post.summary: Revokes all secrets (via a lease ID prefix) or tokens (via the tokens' path property) generated under a given prefix immediately.

sync.description: Whether or not to perform the revocation synchronously

parameters.name: url_lease_id
parameters.description: The lease identifier to renew. This is included with a lease.

post.summary: Revokes a lease immediately.

lease_id.description: The lease identifier to renew. This is included with a lease.

sync.description: Whether or not to perform the revocation synchronously

/sys/rotate.description: Rotates the backend encryption key used to persist data.

post.summary: Rotates the backend encryption key used to persist data.
Seal the Vault.

/sys/seal-status.description: Returns the seal status of the Vault.

get.summary: Check the seal status of a Vault.

post.summary: Cause the node to give up active status.
post.description: This endpoint forces the node to give up active status. If the node does not have active status, this endpoint does nothing. Note that the node will sleep for ten seconds before attempting to grab the active lock again, but if no standby nodes grab the active lock in the interim, the same node may become the active node again.

/sys/tools/hash.description: Generate a hash sum for input data

post.summary: Generate a hash sum for input data

algorithm.description: Algorithm to use (POST body parameter). Valid values are: * sha2-224 * sha2-256 * sha2-384 * sha2-512 Defaults to "sha2-256".

format.description: Encoding format to use. Can be "hex" or "base64". Defaults to "hex".

/sys/tools/hash/{urlalgorithm}.description: Generate a hash sum for input data

post.summary: Generate a hash sum for input data

algorithm.description: Algorithm to use (POST body parameter). Valid values are: * sha2-224 * sha2-256 * sha2-384 * sha2-512 Defaults to "sha2-256".

format.description: Encoding format to use. Can be "hex" or "base64". Defaults to "hex".

post.summary: Generate random bytes

bytes.description: The number of bytes to generate (POST body parameter). Defaults to 32 (256 bits).

format.description: Encoding format to use. Can be "hex" or "base64". Defaults to "base64".

urlbytes.description: The number of bytes to generate (POST URL parameter)

parameters.name: urlbytes
parameters.description: The number of bytes to generate (POST URL parameter)

post.summary: Generate random bytes

bytes.description: The number of bytes to generate (POST body parameter). Defaults to 32 (256 bits).

format.description: Encoding format to use. Can be "hex" or "base64". Defaults to "base64".

post.summary: Unseal the Vault.

key.description: Specifies a single master key share. This is required unless reset is true.

reset.description: Specifies if previously-provided unseal keys are discarded and the unseal process is reset.

/sys/wrapping/lookup.description: Looks up the properties of a response-wrapped token.

get.summary: Look up wrapping properties for the requester's token.

post.summary: Look up wrapping properties for the given token.
Rotates a response-wrapped token.
Unwraps a response-wrapped token.
Response-wraps an arbitrary JSON object.
